feed.title: Vicki's Blog
feed.subtitle:
"My voice shalt thou hear in the morning, O Lord;
in the morning will I direct my prayer unto thee,
and will look up."
Psalm 5:3

entry.title: Amazing Cuteness!
entry.content: A baby monkey close to death finds comfort and hope from a white pigeon. Click here to see the article. The picture is absolutely amazing!

entry.title: I'm up to Four!
entry.content:
Three more of my pictures have been featured on Explore. A new picture three days in a row!

Highest position 417 on Sunday, 9/9/07. This picture was taken at the National Arboretum.


Highest position 154 on Wednesday 9/12/07. Taken from a scenic overview on Skyline Drive.


And this one today! Highest position 85 on Thursday 9/13/07. It was taken along the C & O Canal, just north of Pennyfield Lock.

entry.title: Flickr Explore
entry.content: This picture of Great Falls that I took last month has made it in to Flickr Explore! Every day Flickr uses a variety of factors to choose 500 photos from the millions in its databanks to feature in Explore. This photo's highest position was 188 on 9/10/07.

entry.title: Rabbit
entry.content: I had a little fun with a photo I took of a rabbit in our neighborhood.

entry.title: Sunset Near Our Home
entry.content:
The heavens declare the glory of God;
and the firmament sheweth his handywork.

Psalm 19:1

entry.title: Sunset Over the C&O Canal
A Quick Sketch
entry.content: I saw this hibiscus flower in the floral print of a dress on a lady sitting in front of me. I started to sketch it, but had to finish it by memory, because she put her jacket on before I was done.

entry.title: Great Falls - Virginia Side
entry.content:
Ever since I got my new camera this spring I have been longing for an opportunity to get some pictures of herons. I finally got my chance today! :) Click here for the Picasa picture album for this trip. Below is a sampling of some of the photos I took.

Black-crowned Night Herons


Great Blue Heron (with fish)


I also got a picture of some folks having fun kayaking on the falls.

entry.title: National Arboretum
entry.content: Last Sabbath we enjoyed a lovely outing to the National Arboretum. The only drawbacks were that it was very hot out, and we got there too late in the day to see the bonsai exhibit. I suppose that just means we need to go back. :)

entry.title: Happy Vicki!
entry.content: I saw ten groundhogs today!

entry.title: Flight 93 Temporary Memorial
Moon Shot - second try
entry.content: I used a tripod this time. :)

entry.title: C&O Canal near Williamsport, MD
entry.content:
Today we enjoyed a rainy day walk along the C & O Canal with some of our friends. Below is a link to a photo album of that day.
C & O Canal


During the afternoon we saw this flower several times. I have been searching my flower books and the internet trying to identify it, but have had no luck so far. Does anyone recognize it?

***Update***
Thanks to the research of Danny's mother I now have the name of the flowers. ~ Thank you!

Ornithogalum nutans

Dogwood ~ of the family Cornaceae




Dogwood Leaves


Dogwood Leaf close-up

Hyacinth


Daffodil ~ Narcissus cultivar

Cercis canadensis

entry.title: Falling Water: Tiffany Glass
An Evening Walk Behind Triadelphia
entry.content: I was hoping to see the family of Pileated Woodpeckers that live in the woods behind our church, but I didn't see any this time.

entry.title: Tulip at Rockville, MD
First Bike Ride of the New Year
entry.content:
We didn't make it very far. William has just recovered from strep and a rather nasty penicillin reaction, and I still am not functioning in top form yet. The red maple buds weren't helping anything! They are beautiful, but they sure wreck havoc with my sinuses.




Canada Goose

link.title: First Bike Ride of the New Year

entry.title: Moon Shot - first try
entry.content: I attempted a 12x photo of the moon with no tripod. I need to get up in the attic and find the tripod and try again.
